text:
Rami Rami is drinking an Electric Owl by Drakes Brewing Company at Powiśle

Orzechy, galka muszkatulowa, migdaly, kawa, zboze... dziwna ta paleta ale fajna. Dosc lekkie w odbiorze, nie za wiele ciala, chce sie siegac

Dark brown, big tan head, lacing. Aroma of strong coffee, pungent, almost peppery. Coffee is the dominant flavour too, and its good coffee! It goes along with roasted malts, chocolate, nuts, some citrus notes, peppery spicy. Well balanced between sweet and bitter, it presents a medium body, creamy feel, soft carbonation and a long finish. Outstanding!

Bomber from the Woodland CostCo. Pours brown with a large creamy/foamy tan head. Aroma is rather spicy coffee. Med body or better. Flavor is lightly spicy coffee, some smooth roasted malt, and maybe a touch of something like citrus. Theres a bitterness that even burns a bit. Not dry, but the bitterness is enough to make that tolerable. Browns not my fave, but this one is good enough to be a fave.
Draft. During my bachelor party long weekend in the san francisco area, second stop Drakes Dealership. Brown pour with light head. Roasted, coffee, sweet toffee, and light cities tones.

Bomber from hayduke that we had together via facebook chat. Dark brown pour that has a two plus fingers of beige foam. all kinds of coffee in the aroma. It is rich and earthy but not over roasted. That translates to the flavor, too. Some light fruity bitterness pops in and is a nice offset. It is also lightly herbal. The coffee is surprisingly complex. A little toffee, a little citrus, a lot of earth. That coffee is in charge, though. Very good stuff.

Shared with Strykzone of Facebook Chat. From a bomber poured amber down with a large and long lasting off-white that left good lacing. Nose of coffee, rich roasted malts, and some fruit. Medium plus body. Flavor is rich and while coffee is dominate the fruit and chocolate mats support it. Finishes with more spiciness than bitterness Very tasty and nice

Bottle. Pours a brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty coffee caramel aroma. Slightly roasted malty caramel and coffee flavor. Has a slightly roasted malty coffee and caramel finish.

Bomber to glass - Color of cola, khaki head, kinda smallish. Aroma of tea leaves, earthy nuts, some coffee. Creamy with a slight zesty crispness towards the back. Coffee, nuts, mint, caramel and toasted malt. Pretty bueno.

From tap at Drakes Dealership, Oakland. Clear copper brown color with off white to beige head. Heavy malty and light hoppy aroma, roasted, caramel, milk chocolate, lots of coffee. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

On tap @ Drakes. Cola colored beer with some khaki foam. Definitely a good rich coffee aroma. Kind of nutty and sweet. Has some nice roasted malts, a hint of chocolate covered orange, and a touch of spice. The coffee is quite pronounced on the tongue as well. Kind of reminiscent of one of those sweetened coffee drinks. Just a hint of bitterness to it on the finish. Its fine.

Bottle at home. It pours a dark brown/amber color with a frothy, khaki head. The aroma has strong roasted coffee without much malt character. Maybe some light toast. The flavor is also very strong with coffee with a hint of syrup and peppery bitterness. A little dark fruit. Good, not great.

Tap. Copper color with tan ring. Aroma is aromatic coffee, dark malts. Taste is coffee, coffee, coffee. Medium soft carbonation, soft oily mouthfeel. Great beer, but one-dimensional. The coffee is very prominent. But then again, Brown Ale is a subtle style, so when you load it with coffee, youre gonna load it with coffee.

Bottle from city beer San Fran. Lots of dark roast coffee that shines right through. Almost a vegitable flavor. Bit of citrus from the coffee notes and toffee from the malt in the brown ale base. Not bad.

Bottle. Clear mahogany color with light tan foam. Nice earthy herbal, green coffee, nutty, light chocolate aromas. Medium bodied. Sugared up herbal earthy coffee, dark fruit, nutty , caramel flavors---nice cold weather sipper
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Growler Guys, Seattle. Clear, roasty brown. Sweet coffee and brown ale nose, as expected. But very inviting. Peppery roast. Sweet sip, round body. Coffee is a light sweet roast that rounds out the finish. Spicy finish, some alcohol presence. Enjoyable.
Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours medium brown with a thick tan head and a chocolate ad coffee aroma. There is a rich chocolate malt flavor with some toffee and a lot of coffee. A pleasure to drink.

This brown ale rocks! Rich mahogany color with a light tan head. Rich caramel and toffee with robust coffee on the nose. Rich and decadent flavors of smooth coffee with toffee, caramel and subtle citrus bite. Slight warming in the finish.
Bottle. Mahogany beer with a dark cream head. Coffee and light roast aroma. Coffee and roast flavor with light fruitiness. Medium bodied. Coffee and nuttiness linger with roast and light caramel.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2016 Semi sweet nutty coffee aromas. You can see about halfway through the brown beer with lasting froth head. Really nice rich nutty coffee the froth cream comes through. The bitter is mild the roasted malts fade slow and nice.
It tastes and smells of coffee, but the coffee is stale; tastes more like a beer thats been poured and left out for a few days. Its drinkable, but not great.

From bottle to tulip. Delicate roasted coffee aroma. Brown with ruby highlights and a white head that quickly fades to a collar. Taste is coffee dominated. A little one dimensional, but very much tasty and awesome.
Has a Scottish Ale look about it, caramel brown, the smell is coffee caramel, slight toffee, the taste is much of the same, surprising malty sweetness. Good burn, nice ABV at 8%. Good beer.

Draft at Toad in the Hole. Medium brown, clear, with low, fine, off-white foam. Nutty, apple, and lightly roasted aromas. Coffee is much more prominent in the flavor. A great match with a full brekkie.
Pours a deep amber brown color with an off white head. Coffee, caramel, toffee, toast, light chocolate and nut aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a coffee and toffee finish.

Pours two fingers of light tan head on a brown body.
Aroma is roasted and toasted malt, wood, coffee, earth and chocolate. Really nice.
Taste has a solid coffee bitterness, some orange background, chocolate and a coffee finish.
Texture is crisp.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is rich coffee, espresso, roasted malts. Taste is dark coffee, some cocoa. Extremely drinkable and intense, rich coffee flavor (usually being more stale or spent coffee in other coffee beers). This is a Brown Ale?! Who knew a Brown Ale could be so great! Kudos Drakes.
